channel.title: Getting Started on PEARG Documentation
channel.description: Recent content in Getting Started on PEARG Documentation

item.title: Compute Resources
item.description: This page lists the compute resources available to PEARG lab members. Cloud Servers These clusters are hosted on the Nectar cloud. Email jchung@unimelb.edu.au to request an account. When using these servers you should follow the best practices described in these documents. Each server has 10 - 30 TB of storage space which is not backed up. It is your own responsibility to have backups of your important data. Mosquito Server (mozzie) IP address: 115.

item.title: Getting an Account
item.description: To obtain an account on mozzie or rescue, email jchung@unimelb.edu.au and request an account. Please include your preferred username in the email. After you SSH into the server, the first thing you should do is change your password. You can do this with the passwd command and follow the prompts.

item.title: Getting Help
item.description: For help related to getting/using compute resources or queries related to bioinformatics, email Jessica Chung (jchung@unimelb.edu.au). For help related to Mediaflux and metadata, email Tom Schmidt (tom.schmidt@unimelb.edu.au) or Jessica Chung (jchung@unimelb.edu.au).
